content:
Yes, there are several online multiplayer games that incorporate puzzle-solving, strategy, or decision-making as part of their gameplay, including:

1. Among Us - a game about teamwork and deception where players work together to maintain a spaceship, while trying to identify and vote off any imposter(s) among them.

2. Minecraft - a crafting and survival game that includes puzzle-solving elements as players navigate through dangerous environments and build structures using resources.

3. Hearthstone - a digital collectible card game that relies heavily on strategy and decision-making as players build decks and devise tactics to outsmart their opponents.

4. Overwatch - a team-based first-person shooter that requires players to use different hero abilities to outwit and outmaneuver their opponents.

5. League of Legends - a multiplayer online battle arena game that involves strategic decision-making and teamwork to defeat the other team's base.

6. Portal 2 - a cooperative puzzle-solving game that requires players to use logic and critical thinking to progress through complex levels.

7. Team Fortress 2 - a team-based first-person shooter that incorporates strategy and decision-making as players choose different classes and work together to achieve objectives.
